text:
How to set up sharing notes on iPhone
03 Nov 2019, 13:30 by Artyom Surovtsev
Not all iPhone users know about a cool and useful feature that allows you to quickly and conveniently work with notes with friends or colleagues.
üìç Thank you re: Store for the helpful information. üëå
Shared notes imply rights to view notes or make changes to other users.
How to set up shared notes



1. Create a new note or select an existing one.
2. In the upper right corner, click the icon to add users.
3. In the Sharing Options menu, select the rights for new users: only view or edit.
4. When choosing a method for sending a link, add users from the list of contacts to whom access will be granted.
5. Send the link to the note in iCloud in any convenient way.
When the user who receives the link confirms the invitation, a corresponding icon will appear on the note.



After the note is shared, in the sharing menu, you can enable the selection of user-made changes and activate notifications about editing notes.
Here, if necessary, user rights are changed, new ones are added or the sharing of the note is disabled.



In case of frequent need to share notes, you can make a whole folder shared. To do this, in the list of folders with notes, do a side swipe and share the folder in the same way.
